results.title: Head
results.creator_credit: Raybert Productions, Columbia, Bob Rafelson and Jack Nicholson
results.brief_description: In search for meaning, U.S. sixties band The Monkees roll from one adventure to another in this hilarious plotless movie that manages to sum up the iconography of the day. Through an explosion of images from the sixties, the band bursts through with their silly antics and witty asides on a trajectory to pastiche some of the spirit the pop culture gave birth to in the 20th century. With a cast that includes The Monkees (Peter Tork, David Jones, Mickey Dolenz, Michael Nesmith), Victor Mature, Frank Zappa and Sonny Liston, ‘Head’ manages to turn everything back onto itself.

results.title: He who rests rusts
results.brief_description: An animated film demonstrating the necessity for consistent training and exercise in maintaining physical fitness. The champion cat athlete becomes complacent and therefore loses a challenge race.

results.title: He went to the cupboard
results.creator_credit: Great Britain. Ministry of Education and Andrew Buchanan
results.brief_description: A study of pantry lay-out, and the necessity for forethought in planning the use of cupboard space. Married life is subjectively represented through domestic ponderance and male ignorance of the kitchen politic.

results.title: He's not the walking kind
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Peter Jones and Sandra Wilson
results.brief_description: The story of a young man who, despite a crippling malady is determined to experience as many of life’s offerings as possible. Brian Wilson is a spastic, confined to a wheelchair, but he works at a job, looks after himself, moving about from place to place on his own. Every day has its challenges and victories and sometimes defeats. An insight into the private daily struggle of the handicapped.

results.title: Hazard
results.creator_credit: Interfilm Productions, Geoffrey Sumner and Tom Stobart
results.brief_description: An accident prevention film intended primarily for showing to new workers entering the steel industry. Aims at a person’s attitude to safety rather than suggesting specific safety rules, through the story of two steelworkers on a mountaineering holiday. Compares their attitude to risks in the mountains with a professional attitude to risks on the job.

results.title: Hayley Mills storybook volume 3
results.brief_description: Hayley Mills presents 6 animated children’s tales including: “Myra”, “I’m not Oscar’s friend anymore”, “Martha Ann and the mother store”, “The Man who had no dream”, plus two tales from the Brothers Grimm, “Hans in luck” and “Three golden hairs”.
